On 11/13/06, Chris Barham <cbarham@...> wrote:
>
> For example the JUnit 4 code is not working as I expected when I used
> the @RunWith(Enclosed.class)
> annotation - it only picks up the enclosed classes, not the public
> 'outer' class.


That's by design.  I'm open to the possibility that there's a good reason
someone would want to mix test methods and classes in the same container
class, but I'm not sure your example suffices--why not wrap your single
stray test method in an informatively named test class?

Thanks,

   David Saff

>
>
